title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that yes, Sam would be able to buy 3 units of Good C and 3 candles and/or does not explain that his total expenditures would be $15 (=$2×3+$3×3) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44CE@ , which is less than his weekly income of $21.

The response states that yes, Sam would be able to buy 3 units of Good C and 3 candles and explains that his total expenditures would be $15 (=$2×3+$3×3) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44CE@ , which is less than his weekly income of $21.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the total consumer surplus as $54 and/or does not show the work.

Total Consumer Surplus = Total Benefit – Total Expenditures  = $66 – $12 = $54 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@79D7@

The response calculates the total consumer surplus as $54 and shows the work.

Total Consumer Surplus = Total Benefit – Total Expenditures  = $66 – $12 = $54 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@79D7@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify that 3 units of Good C and 5 candles will maximize Sam’s total benefit given his weekly income of $21 and/or does not explain that for the last unit of each good consumed the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of Good C (6) is equal to the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of candles (6), or

M B Good C Pric e Good C = M B Candles Pric e Candles MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5F4A@

$12 $2 = $18 $3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41CB@

6=6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaaiAdacqGH9aqpcaaI2aaaaa@3BA2@

The response identifies that 3 units of Good C and 5 candles will maximize Sam’s total benefit given his weekly income of $21 and explains that for the last unit of each good consumed the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of Good C (6) is equal to the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of candles (6), or

M B Good C Pric e Good C = M B Candles Pric e Candles MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5F4A@

$12 $2 = $18 $3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41CB@

6=6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaaiAdacqGH9aqpcaaI2aaaaa@3BA2@

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· States that the quantity of Good C that will maximize Sam’s total benefit will increase and explains that a decrease in the number of consumers in the market for Good C will decrease the demand for Good C, which will decrease the price of Good C and increase the marginal benefit per dollar spent that Sam gets from each additional unit of the good.

· States that Sam’s total consumer surplus would increase and explains that a decrease in the price of Good C would decrease the total cost of consuming 6 units of Good C while the total benefit of consuming 6 units of candles remains the same.

The response does one of the following:

· States that the quantity of Good C that will maximize Sam’s total benefit will increase and explains that a decrease in the number of consumers in the market for Good C will decrease the demand for Good C, which will decrease the price of Good C and increase the marginal benefit per dollar spent that Sam gets from each additional unit of the good.

· States that Sam’s total consumer surplus would increase and explains that a decrease in the price of Good C would decrease the total cost of consuming 6 units of Good C while the total benefit of consuming 6 units of candles remains the same.

The response does both of the following:

· States that the quantity of Good C that will maximize Sam’s total benefit will increase and explains that a decrease in the number of consumers in the market for Good C will decrease the demand for Good C, which will decrease the price of Good C and increase the marginal benefit per dollar spent that Sam gets from each additional unit of the good.

· States that Sam’s total consumer surplus would increase and explains that a decrease in the price of Good C would decrease the total cost of consuming 6 units of Good C while the total benefit of consuming 6 units of candles remains the same.
